PCA.Name: Barclays Bank Account With Emergency Borrowing

Overdraft.Notes: Maximum charges for authorised overdrafts in a 31 day month.

Notes: NOTE - Barclays Overdrafts and Emergency Borrowing are charged daily fees (not interest rates) to make the cost of an overdraft easy to  understand. If you're facing a number of different charges on your overdraft or Unpaid fee in any one day, we'll only charge you a single fee – whichever is the highest.

NOTE - Barclays Overdrafts and Emergency Borrowing are charged daily fees (not interest rates) to make the cost of an overdraft easy to  understand. If you're facing a number of different charges on your overdraft or Unpaid fee in any one day, we’ll only charge you a single fee – whichever is the highest.

NOTE - Barclays Overdrafts and Emergency Borrowing are charged daily fees (not interest rates) to make the cost of an overdraft easy to  understand. If you're facing a number of different charges on your overdraft or Unpaid fee in any one day, we’ll only charge you a single fee – whichever is the highest.

NOTE - Barclays Overdrafts and Emergency Borrowing are charged daily fees (not interest rates) to make the cost of an overdraft easy to  understand. If you're facing a number of different charges on your overdraft or Unpaid fee in any one day, we’ll only charge you a single fee – whichever is the highest. Emergency Borrowing is capped at seven days in each monthly charging period, so using your Emergency Borrowing will never cost you more than £35 per month.
Eligibility for this account depends on you meeting our credit criteria, including checks we may carry out with credit and fraud prevention agencies.

FeatureBenefitItem.Name: LifeSkills
Notes: An Education programme designed to give young people access to the skills they need to make the transition into work. It focuses on the three critical areas of People Skills, Work Skills and Money Skills.

FeatureBenefitItem.Name: Digital Wings, by Barclays
Notes: Access to Tools and tutorials to help boost your digital knowledge

FeatureBenefitItem.Name: Cloud It
Notes: The digital home for customers’ Barclays documents, including statements and account summaries– a great way to help customers go paperless. Customers can also upload digital copies of important documents to their cloud, such as their bills, driving licence and passport.

FeatureBenefitItem.Name: Free text alerts
Notes: Receive information about your current account via texts to your mobile phone. Customers can register for any one, a selection, or all of the alerts we currently offer.

FeatureBenefitItem.Name: Personalised debit card
Notes: Personalise your debit card with your favourite photo or choose one from our gallery.

FeatureBenefitItem.Name: SmartSpend
Notes: All UK current account customers who are over 18 and have BMB (Barclays Mobile Banking) or Online Banking can access cashback and offers.

FeatureBenefitItem.Name: Blue Rewards
FeatureBenefitItem.Textual: RegularDeposit of minimum £800
Notes: With Blue Rewards, you’ll get rewards each month, plus cashback from over 200 retailers when you shop – all for just £3 per month. Conditions apply.

FeatureBenefitEligibility.Name: Blue Rewards
FeatureBenefitEligibility.Description: With Blue Rewards, you’ll get rewards each month, plus cashback from over 200 retailers when you shop – all for just £3 per month. Conditions apply.

FeatureBenefitItem.Name: Tech Pack
FeatureBenefitItem.Textual: From your mobile phone and laptop, to your tablet and camera – protect what's important to you with our Tech Pack. When adding your first pack no daily fees are charged on arranged overdrafts up to £200. When you go over your £200 limit, daily fees are charged on the whole balance of your arranged overdraft. (Subject to status). Monthly Fee is £9.50 (changing to £12.50 from March 2018)

FeatureBenefitItem.Name: Tech Pack
FeatureBenefitItem.Textual: Get worldwide family travel insurance and comprehensive UK & European RAC breakdown cover When adding your first pack no daily fees are charged on arranged overdrafts up to £200. When you go over your £200 limit, daily fees are charged on the whole balance of your arranged overdraft. (Subject to status). Monthly Fee is £10.50

FeatureBenefitItem.Name: Travel Plus Pack
FeatureBenefitItem.Textual: Get airport lounge access, airport parking and hotels discounts, worldwide family travel insurance and comprehensive UK & European RAC breakdown cover When adding your first pack no daily fees are charged on arranged overdrafts up to £200. When you go over your £200 limit, daily fees are charged on the whole balance of your arranged overdraft. (Subject to status). Monthly Fee is £15.50

FeatureBenefitItem.Name: Control Feature
FeatureBenefitItem.Textual: Take control of your money and put an end to Unpaid Transaction Fees, for a small monthly fee that could save you money. If you regularly have transactions returned because of a lack of funds, and as a result incur charges, Control Feature could be for you.. Monthly Fee is £8.00

FeatureBenefitItem.Name: Credit Manager
FeatureBenefitItem.Textual: Credit Manager is a non-insurance service designed to give customers access to their market credit profile information, and support to responsibly manage and help to protect their profile from damage caused by identity fraud.. Monthly Fee is £5.00

OtherEligibility.Name: Previous Bankruptcy included
OtherEligibility.Textual: Barclays Basic Current Account is a basic account that offers free, no-frills banking for customers who may not be able to open a regular current account. The Barclays Basic Current Account (BBCA) is available only to customers who have experienced serious financial difficulty or do not currently have access to a bank account in the UK

Notes: Barclays Basic Current Account is a basic account that offers free, no-frills banking for customers who may not be able to open a regular current account. You can qualify for this account if you don't qualify for one of our other accounts and/or you have no existing bank current account in the UK. The Barclays Basic Current Account (BBCA) is available only to customers who have experienced serious financial difficulty or do not currently have access to a bank account in the UK.

Overdraft.Notes: Maximum charges for authorised overdrafts in a 31 day month.

Notes: NOTE - Barclays Overdrafts and Emergency Borrowing are charged daily fees (not interest rates) to make the cost of an overdraft easy to  understand. If you're facing a number of different charges on your overdraft or Unpaid fee in any one day, we’ll only charge you a single fee – whichever is the highest.

NOTE - Barclays Overdrafts and Emergency Borrowing are charged daily fees (not interest rates) to make the cost of an overdraft easy to  understand. If you're facing a number of different charges on your overdraft or Unpaid fee in any one day, we’ll only charge you a single fee – whichever is the highest.

NOTE - Barclays Overdrafts and Emergency Borrowing are charged daily fees (not interest rates) to make the cost of an overdraft easy to  understand. If you're facing a number of different charges on your overdraft or Unpaid fee in any one day, we’ll only charge you a single fee – whichever is the highest.

NOTE - Barclays Overdrafts and Emergency Borrowing are charged daily fees (not interest rates) to make the cost of an overdraft easy to  understand. If you're facing a number of different charges on your overdraft or Unpaid fee in any one day, we’ll only charge you a single fee – whichever is the highest.

NOTE - Barclays Overdrafts and Emergency Borrowing are charged daily fees (not interest rates) to make the cost of an overdraft easy to  understand. If you're facing a number of different charges on your overdraft or Unpaid fee in any one day, we’ll only charge you a single fee – whichever is the highest. Emergency Borrowing is capped at seven days in each monthly charging period, so using your Emergency Borrowing will never cost you more than £35 per month.
Eligibility for this account depends on you meeting our credit criteria, including checks we may carry out with credit and fraud prevention agencies.

FeatureBenefitItem.Name: LifeSkills
Notes: An Education programme designed to give young people access to the skills they need to make the transition into work. It focuses on the three critical areas of People Skills, Work Skills and Money Skills.

FeatureBenefitItem.Name: Digital Wings, by Barclays
Notes: Access to Tools and tutorials to help boost your digital knowledge

FeatureBenefitItem.Name: Cloud It
Notes: The digital home for customers’ Barclays documents, including statements and account summaries– a great way to help customers go paperless. Customers can also upload digital copies of important documents to their cloud, such as their bills, driving licence and passport.

FeatureBenefitItem.Name: Free text alerts
Notes: Receive information about your current account via texts to your mobile phone. Customers can register for any one, a selection, or all of the alerts we currently offer.

FeatureBenefitItem.Name: Personalised debit card
Notes: Personalise your debit card with your favourite photo or choose one from our gallery.

FeatureBenefitItem.Name: SmartSpend
Notes: All UK current account customers who are over 18 and have BMB (Barclays Mobile Banking) or Online Banking can access cashback and offers.

FeatureBenefitItem.Name: Blue Rewards
FeatureBenefitItem.Textual: RegularDeposit of minimum £800
Notes: With Blue Rewards, you’ll get rewards each month, plus cashback from over 200 retailers when you shop – all for just £3 per month. Conditions apply.

PCA.Name: Student Additions Account with Emergency Borrowing

Overdraft.Notes: Barclays Overdrafts and Emergency Borrowing are charged daily fees (not interest rates) to make the cost of an overdraft easy to  understand. You can apply for an initial £500 fee-free overdraft when you open your account and up to £3,000 fee-free while you’re studying (all overdrafts including fee-free amounts are subject to application, status and lending criteria). The maximum overdraft limits are: Account opening: up to £500, Year 1: up to £1,000, Year 2: up to £2,000 and Year 3: up to £3,000. If you're facing a number of different charges on your overdraft or Unpaid fee in any one day, we’ll only charge you a single fee whichever is the highest.

Overdraft.Notes: Barclays overdrafts are charged daily fees (not interest rates) to make the cost of an overdraft easy to  understand. You can apply for an initial £500 fee-free overdraft when you open your account and up to £3,000 fee-free while you’re studying (all overdrafts including fee-free amounts are subject to application, status and lending criteria). The maximum overdraft limits are: Account opening: up to £500, Year 1: up to £1,000, Year 2: up to £2,000 and Year 3: up to £3,000. If you're facing a number of different charges on your overdraft or Unpaid fee in any one day, we’ll only charge you a single fee whichever is the highest.
